sentences.english: The traditional research often regards the idiom as one kind of result to do the static analysis.
sentences.chinese: 傳統的研究往往把熟語看作一種結果來做靜態地分析。

sentences.english: Chapter four -the cultural reason of Chinese idioms.
sentences.chinese: 第四章是漢語熟語的文化理據。

sentences.english: Chinese and French idiomatic phrases are treasures in both languages.
sentences.chinese: 法漢熟語都是語言中的瑰寶。

sentences.english: This paper make a primary study on Meixian idiom.
sentences.chinese: 本文對梅縣熟語進行了初步研究。

sentences.english: The research object and range of the idiom culture are put forward too.
sentences.chinese: 提出了熟語文化研究的對象和範圍。

sentences.english: However, much more idioms mirror the different features of their own culture.
sentences.chinese: 而民族文化間的差異則更明顯地通過熟語表現出來。

sentences.english: There are as many colloquialisms in Japanese as are in Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 中日文中存在着大量的四字熟語。

sentences.english: Idioms, as the cream of language, embody abundant cultural information.
sentences.chinese: 熟語是語言的精華，承載着大量文化信息。

definition: to communicate by means of written notes (instead of speaking)/to publish one's opinion (e.g. as part of a scholarly dialogue)/(in book titles) essays/sketches
to write a word incorrectly/typo/(medicine) to mistakenly transplant (an infected organ etc)
to make a sound effect/sound effect/(historical linguistics) to reconstruct the sound system of an archaic language
Takeshima (Korean Dokdo 獨島|独岛[Du2 dao3]), disputed islands in Sea of Japan
same tone/in agreement with/homology (invariant of a topological space in math.)
normally/as things should be/by rights/to reason things out/logic
